response:
A young adult with subacute unilateral optic neuropathy and subtle additional CNS signs is most likely to have inflammatory demyelinating optic neuritis within a multiple sclerosis-spectrum disorder; antibody-mediated demyelinating diseases and other optic neuropathies must be excluded, along with compressive and infectious/inflammatory causes.
